item.title: How To: Replace an Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor
item.description: 2004 Honda Accord outside of a detail shop This is my 2004 Accord. It has been my daily driver for 6 years. It has 285k miles. Everything works and itâ€™s great â€” except that lately the throttle has beenâ€¦ weird. It starts jerky and doesnâ€™t cruise at a consistent speed even if I am very smooth with my pedal input. I hooked up my OBD reader (on-board diagnostic reader) to see if I had any error codes.

item.title: Make a Stack Overflow Reputation Leader Board for Your Team With Python

item.title: Why I Blasted Your Drug Deals on Twitter
item.description: How it happened A couple of days ago Twitter user Mike Rundle tweeted a link for the endpoint to Venmoâ€™s public API. I learned that Venmoâ€™s public by default setting made the details of millions of Venmo transactions publicly available to anyone who cared to look. So I did what any software engineer would do and started digging through the data. I could see the names, Facebook profile pictures, payment types and â€œmessageâ€ fields that users filled out when they made a transaction.

item.title: How To: SSH to Your Azure Linux VMs With Username and Password From Windows, Linux or Mac
item.description: If youâ€™re looking to generate SSH keys and use them to login to an Azure Linux VM then good on you because thatâ€™s the recommended and most secure method to access your VMs. Itâ€™s readily documented here in official documentation. However, Iâ€™ve seen people asking on forums how to simply connect to a Linux VM hosted in Azure via SSH with a username and password. If thatâ€™s you then I assume you have a good reason (like this VM will generally not have ports open to the internet or this is a proof of concept) and this post will detail how.

item.title: How To: Embed Your Azure Web App Bot in Any Web Page
item.description: Embedding an Azure bot in your web page is actually very simple but the Azure portal doesnâ€™t make it obvious how to do this. The portal blade for bots is geared towards developers who are integrating bots into channels like Skype, Facebook Messenger, Slack, SMS, etc but Iâ€™ve seen several questions on Stack Overflow asking how to simply slap the bot on a web page - so here you go.
